oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Letter from William Thompson to his sister
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: This letter, written by Confederate soldier William Thompson on 11 December 1862 from a "camp near Murfreesboro", refers to cavalry actions around Nashville. It mentions Gen. Morgan and the capture of 1400 by the Texas Rangers on the Nolensville Pike. Letter continues on to say that having "the great "Jos. E. Johnston to command us, we can whip twice our number, a great commander, an Army of Tennesseans will prove an eternal bulwark to our beloved M. Tennessee."
